storyInfo: After the passing of an Oripathy patient, Ceylon receives a heartfelt request from a close friend of the deceased, causing her to realize that she is not truly ready to face the death of a loved one.

attributes.content: Is there really no possibility, director?
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: You know as well as I do that the remains of the Infected cannot be taken out for a funeral.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: What about the ashes?
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: Even the ashes must be processed to ensure that there is no risk prior to being removed.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: We've only recently established this office. The relevant facilities are not yet up to scratch.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: How long will it take?
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: Even if I submitted an application now, it would take at least six months for it to be approved by the landship and for the equipment to arrive.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: ...Do you realize how cruel this is?
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: I was both her doctor and her only friend, but I couldn't even be by her side in her final moments.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: Then, her remains were quarantined.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: And now I need to submit an application just to get her ashes back?
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: And this will take months?
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: Please, don't make this difficult.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: You know why we have these rules. We wrote some of them together.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I've been working with Rhodes Island for a year now. I'm only asking for this one thing.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: I couldn't travel with her when she was alive. The least I can do is take her ashes on a journey, now that she's gone.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: It was her final wish.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: We're doctors, Hourglass. We have a responsibility to others.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Are we supposed to act like emotionless robots just because we're doctors?!
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: I don't want to argue with you about this, Hourglass.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I understand that you're grieving. I—
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: If the day comes when this happens to Schwarz...
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: Would you still be trying to convince yourself with the same rules?!
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: You—!
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Disposition is about to begin.
attributes.name: Communications Terminal Announcement

attributes.content: Please enter your identification code, then enter the cremation chamber to begin the process.
attributes.name: Communications Terminal Announcement

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Normally, all dispositions are handled by the office director, meaning me.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: If you want, I can let you handle this. Just this once.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: ...But I'm afraid that's all I can do.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I never got to say goodbye in her last moments. Now I'll never fulfill her final wish. How could I face her now?
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: ...I see.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Dressed in full protective equipment, Ceylon deftly pushes the cart carrying Delia's body towards the cremator.
She has gotten used to seeing and dealing with the bodies of the Infected.
But this does not make it hurt any less.

attributes.text: 'If the day comes when this happens to Schwarz...'
'Would you still be trying to convince yourself with the same rules?!'

attributes.content: There was clear anger in Hourglass's voice, but Ceylon willingly accepts it.
It is her duty to bear the brunt of such anger. She was prepared for it, ever since she decided to help Rhodes Island establish this office.
As for the question itself—
'It's none of your business what happens between me and Schwarz!'
She almost retorted with that, but of course she could not.
Just as she could not tell Hourglass that 'I understand your pain.'
Regardless of what made Hourglass say it, though, Ceylon had already lost count of how many nights she had spent crying over the possibility.
Every time, she wiped her tears dry, to continue to read the research and write the reports.
It is one of her firm beliefs that tears are less useful than medical research.
If the day comes when it is Schwarz lying on that cart, and it is somebody else pushing it, it could only be because she was prevented from finding a way to save her first.
In which case, she would accept it, she thinks.
She would have done everything she could, she thinks.
I'm sorry, Delia.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Things rarely go the way we want them to.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: She pushes the body into the cremator.
After a moment of silence, she presses the button.
...Good night.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: What are you looking at?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: The sea.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: She didn't like the sea. She said she'd gotten sick of it, after seeing it all her life.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: She always said she wanted to go on a journey. That she'd go once she'd saved up enough money. But it wasn't meant to be.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I've calmed down now. I'm sorry for shouting like that.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: It's alright. I'm glad you understand.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I'll hold a funeral for her in a few days.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: Have you already made the arrangements?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Yes. I started planning it long ago.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: The ashes were never necessary. I just wanted to give it one last try.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: You have nothing to apologize for. I know you're hurting too.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: But it's hard to keep your cool at a time like this.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: Will you come to her funeral?
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: A few days later
The road from Fashion Street to the shore is paved with flowers. Massive flower baskets line the sidewalks.
A temporary stage has been erected at the end of the street, with a dozen chairs set up in front of it.
A photo of Delia hangs high above the stage.
Delia's parents died when she was young. She led a secluded life after contracting Oripathy, but she had a friend who stayed by her side until the very end—Renata.
attributes.name: Funeral Officiant

attributes.content: We'd like to invite Renata to come on stage.
attributes.name: Funeral Officiant

attributes.content: ...Excuse me, I have just been informed that Renata is unable to come, but she has prepared an audio recording for us to play.
attributes.name: Funeral Officiant

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: The first time I saw Delia, she was dancing by the seaside. Back then, I hated my life. I hated everything, and was even thinking of letting the sea take me.
attributes.name: Hourglass's Voice

attributes.content: But somehow, she seemed to know what was going through my head, and started dancing in front of me.
attributes.name: Hourglass's Voice

attributes.content: I will always remember that dance. The way she whirled and leapt across the beach, the way the hem of her dress shone in the sunlight.
attributes.name: Hourglass's Voice

attributes.content: These last few days, all I could think of was that dance, the one burned into my memories.
attributes.name: Hourglass's Voice

attributes.content: I compiled all my memories of her in an album. I thought that was enough.
attributes.name: Hourglass's Voice

attributes.content: I thought I was prepared for the day she would leave us.
attributes.name: Hourglass's Voice

attributes.content: But when I woke up from my dreams with a start, only to find once again that she was no longer there, I just couldn't do it anymore.
attributes.name: Hourglass's Voice

attributes.content: I miss her so much...
attributes.name: Hourglass's Voice

attributes.content: Ceylon feels overwhelmed by emotion. She cannot imagine how she would take it, if the day ever came when it was her turn to experience all this.
Schwarz still has time. Intellectually, she knows that she cannot truly understand what Hourglass is feeling right now.

Yet the fears conjured by her overactive imagination across all those tearful nights begin to overlap with the portrait of pain being painted by Hourglass, prying open the already-fragile barriers of her heart.
She wants to see Hourglass. She wants to talk to her.
Excuse me, sir, do you know where Hourglass... where Renata is?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Er...
attributes.name: Funeral Officiant

attributes.content: Is something the matter?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I'm her supervisor at work. You can trust me.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: ...She just gave me the recording and left. I don't know where she went.
attributes.name: Funeral Officiant

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I'm here, Delia.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: In the end, I lied to the director.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: She's sharp—it won't fool her for long.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: But I don't need much time for this.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: It won't take long for me to take you with me, for us to leave this place together, to go far, far away.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: I'll take you to all the places we visited together.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: And all the places you wanted to go, but never could.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: Then, we'll live quietly together, somewhere we can see the sunset.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: Hourglass mutters as she searches for Delia's name on the shelf holding the ashes.
She has worked here as a doctor for over a year, and treated many patients. Her hand begins to tremble as she sees familiar name after familiar name.
Finally, she finds Delia's name.
The shelf is a little high. She finds a chair and drags it over. The screeching sound it makes on the floor echoes through the room, making her heart skip a beat.
She steps on the chair. With a trembling hand, she tries to put in the key to open the cabinet with Delia's name on it.
Perhaps her tears have clouded her vision, or perhaps her hand is trembling too much, but she cannot get it in.
She tries once, twice, many times.
Until the tears are all over her face.
Until the key slips from her hand.
Until she falls from the chair after bending down to pick up the key.
Until she is sitting on the ground in a daze.
Until she cannot hold it back anymore, and begins to cry her heart out.
I'm sorry, Delia.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: I'm sorry...
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: It's me. Is Hourglass there?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Director! I thought you asked her to come pick up Delia's ashes?
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Where is she?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: She just left. Crying.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: I need you to—
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Hm, that's odd.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Yes? What is it?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Well...
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: Something was obviously off about her, so I went in to see what was going on.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: She didn't take Delia's ashes?
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: In fact, it looks like she didn't even open the cabinet.
attributes.name: Office Operator

attributes.content: ...I'm coming back right now.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: How did she do it?
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: The way she taught me... first a spin, then another—
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: Ouch!
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: Look how clumsy I am. I could never dance with the passion that you did.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: Hourglass!
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: How did you find me, director?
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: You mentioned the beach where you first met her, in your recording.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I immediately knew you must have meant this place. I used to play here all the time.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: ...I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: I stole your pass while you were at the funeral.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: That doesn't matter... Well, maybe it does a little. But why?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: How do we prepare ourselves for the passing of a loved one?
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: You've always said you would do everything you can to prevent it.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: As for me, I recorded everything about her.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: And look what happened.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: I haven't had a single night's sleep since she died.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: I even broke the rules to steal her ashes.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: Why didn't you then?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: When I saw the shelf holding her ashes, I realized how meaningless it all was.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: It's not her ashes I wanted to take.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: She's dead.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: All I wanted was to see her one last time. And it made me do something so stupid.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: What finally hit me was that—
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: She's never coming back.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: I wasn't ready for that.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: How could I be?
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: Ceylon sits down next to Hourglass.
My father was always busy when I was little. Schwarz was both my bodyguard and my companion.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I liked to sneak out and walk towards the volcano.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I never managed to reach it, though, because Schwarz always stopped me partway.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: But there was always something fun, something interesting, at wherever she stopped me.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: And so I would enjoy myself there, and follow her home.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I always thought those days would last forever.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Until I learned what Oripathy was.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: And so I set my mind to curing her.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: To be honest, I'm even more selfish than you.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: If there's a chance I can cure her, I will seize it, even if it means sacrificing the time I get to spend with her.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I always thought that, this way, I could console myself when the time comes—that I gave her all the time I could.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: But it's just as you said. We were both wrong. All our preparations will mean nothing when our loved ones really leave us.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: It was hard enough listening to your recording at the funeral.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: If the day really does come when Schwarz leaves me... I would probably take it even worse than you did.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: That's how I used to be...
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: We're all the same, until we truly come face-to-face with the final farewell of death.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: Proud, blind. Thinking we can take it.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: But when someone we love dies, they take part of us with them.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: We can never be whole again.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: If... just hypothetically...
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: If you really did take her ashes... where would you go?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I... I would have traveled with them.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: I wanted to take her to all the places we've visited together.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: I wanted to take her ashes to all the places we weren't able to.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: But... that's just wishful thinking.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: ...Go. Do it.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: I said go do it.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I never told anyone that you stole my pass. Officially, you still have my permission to take Delia's ashes.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I'll go back to the landship and submit a formal application for you to go on your journey.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: There will a penalty, of course. I'm going to dock your pay for six months.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: We also don't have a suitable container in New Siesta yet. While I'm there, I'll ask Engineering to prepare one.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: That'll be quicker than waiting for them to send us one.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Wherever you go, however, you must report to the local Rhodes Island office and have your container examined.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: If anything dangerous happens, or if I find you spread her ashes anywhere—
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: You're finished.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Other than that, though, I'll ask them to work with you and allow you to go wherever you want with Delia.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: ...But there's no point.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: I know I said we were wrong. But were we?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: We raged against the dying of the light. If parting is inevitable, if we can never be whole again—
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Then, at the very least, the traces our loved ones left behind might fill in that hole, little by little.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I'm sorry for acting like I understand what you're going through.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Our situations are different. It's also not my place to order you to do anything. I just thought that, if the day ever comes for me...
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I would go everywhere we had left our marks together and cry there. Just like you did.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Once I'd cried my heart out and my tears run dry, then I'd start thinking about what to do next.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: But if not even that works...
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Then let's get together and talk again.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: ...Mm-hm.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: Thank you, director.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: I'm not sure I can be as strong as all that...
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: But I'll try.
attributes.name: Hourglass

attributes.content: How's my condition, Medic?
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: A little worse than last year.
attributes.name: Medic

attributes.content: You've been pushing yourself too hard these past couple years, both as an instructor and as an operator.
attributes.name: Medic

attributes.content: I'll put in a request to reduce your workload.
attributes.name: Medic

attributes.content: But my reassignment request—
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: Would you stop pushing yourself once you get back to New Siesta?
attributes.name: Medic

attributes.content: I'll get plenty of rest.
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: Oh, please. You've been with us for two years now, you think we don't know you?
attributes.name: Medic

attributes.content: You'd never take care of yourself, not without someone forcing you to.
attributes.name: Medic

attributes.content: Ceylon would've been the best for the job, but with the New Siesta office just getting up and running, it's going to be at least a year before we're comfortable with letting you go back.
attributes.name: Medic

attributes.content: But—
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: Then I'll care for her here on the landship.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Lady Ceylon?!
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: Hey Ceylon. You're back already?
attributes.name: Medic

attributes.content: I was hoping to give Schwarz a little surprise, though.
attributes.name: Medic

attributes.content: Oh, did I interrupt you? Apologies.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Okay, take 2!
attributes.name: Ceylon, Outside the Door

attributes.content: ...I see.
attributes.name: Medic

attributes.content: Ahem. Anyway, there's no need to worry, Schwarz. We've come up with the perfect solution for your situation.
attributes.name: Medic

attributes.content: Which is—
attributes.name: Medic

attributes.content: Ta-da!
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: And there you go. Soon after you returned, Ceylon made a request to stay on the landship for a while.
attributes.name: Medic

attributes.content: Anyway, problem solved. Now I'll give you two some space to catch up.
attributes.name: Medic

attributes.content: Lady Ceylon... I thought you were busy in New Siesta.
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: I talked to Father. He agreed to give the green light for Rhodes Island on certain matters.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: They'll be fine without me for a while.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I was doing fine by myself. You didn't need to worry.
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: Are you sure you weren't thinking about how to hide your condition from me?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Well... no. You would find out anyway.
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: That's more like it.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Medic was right. You need rest.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: So let's go on a trip, Schwarz.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Where to?
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: You know, I just remembered that you once told me about the city where you were born.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I've never been there.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: There's not much left of it.
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: Then we can leave something behind.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Besides, I know all about your time as mercenary, but you've never told me about your childhood.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: ...Why, all of a sudden?
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: I was just thinking... You watched me grow up. You know everything there is to know about me.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: But there's still so much about you I don't know. That's not fair, is it?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I'm nothing if not greedy, Schwarz.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Schwarz

attributes.content: Good. Then let's review your health report, and then we can start planning our trip.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: As you wish.
attributes.name: Schwarz
